game.name: 1043 - Jesus - Kyoufu no Bio Monster (J) [!]
game.info: Some five years after the initial release, Niahak and myself present a much improved patch for Jesus. For those who played the old patch, we recommend you give this one a spin as you will find it to be a completely different experience.

game.name: 1045 - Esper Dream 2 - Aratanaru Tatakai (J) [!]
game.info: Esper Dream 2 is a nifty action/rpg by Konami. The five rings of the Book Worlds have been stolen, and it’s up to our ESP-endowed bookworm hero to find them and save the day! The game itself is fairly neat. You visit a number of different worlds, each symbolized by a bookcase, each very different from the last. A battle sequence is initiated when you come in contact with enemies, which are symbolized by little walking pawprints - you’re then taken to a small arena where you have to destroy your enemies, Zelda-style. It’s pretty fun!

game.name: 1047 - Mouryou Senki Madara (Japan)
game.info: Madara is an… interesting little oldschool RPG. The plot follows Madara, who was found floating in a river with a fair number of his body parts chopped off. Mechanical replacements are forged, and on his 15th birthday he is sent off to recover his real body and real strength to depose the evil Emperor Miroku and save the Fuduraku continent from the ever-advancing forces of the Moki armies. It’s a fairly simple plot, but it’s not without its twists. It’s also a fairly difficult game, especially towards the end. Don’t expect an easy ride on this one!

game.name: 107 - Cosmic Wars (J) [!]

game.name: 1077 - Gorby no Pipeline Daisakusen (J)
game.info: DvD: I did this quick little translation to get me into the mood to work on translations again. harmony7 suggested the humorous subtitle. It’s Compile’s previous attempt to Puyo Puyo to make a Tetris clone, in terms of gameplay. As you’ve probably never heard of this one, it’s obviously not as good. But, it is worth playing if you like these types of games.

game.name: 115 - Deep Dungeon IV - Kuro no Youjutsushi (J) [!]
game.description: Deep Dungeon IV - Kuro no Youjutsushi (J) [!]
game.info: The script formatting here is pretty bad, and really noticeable in a lot of places, due to a lack of space in the ROM to put line breaks and such. In addition, the game’s pointers are screwed up, making the game practically unplayable because the dialogue (including quest descriptions and other important things) makes no sense and doesn’t match up with the Japanese script. kueller promised a 1.1 patch to fix all these problems, but this will most likely never ever happen. As it stands now, at some point in the game the graphics will glitch up so badly that you cannot progress any longer.

patch.name: Deep Dungeon IV - Kuro no Youjutsushi (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Deep Dungeon IV - Kuro no Youjutsushi (J) [!].nes

game.name: 116 - Tenchi o Kurau II - Shokatsu Koumei Den (Japan)
game.description: Tenchi o Kurau II - Shokatsu Koumei Den (Japan)
game.info: Parallel to the setting and background of the actual game, this translation was a long time in the making. It was first started in early 1997 under the direction of Cataclysm X ([cx]), but due to the complexity of the ROM, it had shifted hands many, many times until it finally ended up with Destiny Translations. However, it is mainly Wildbill’s labor of love, he’s been there practically since the start of the project, with a rabid determination that is practically unparallelled in the translation community. He has taken the excellent translations by Faraday, Robin, Musashi, and Varkon - and turned them into a beautiful, mature, well-written script. I have never been exposed to a script so clearly-written - professionally done, or otherwise. ASM and creative use of substring compression by Jair and Taskforce have also helped to integrate the script seemlessly into the game. Kiddies, if you like RPGs, and you don’t try this game out, you’re on crack ^_^.

patch.name: Tenchi o Kurau II - Shokatsu Koumei Den (Japan).ips

rom.name: Tenchi o Kurau II - Shokatsu Koumei Den (Japan).nes

You move carefully to avoid dangers, taking care not to make huge falls. Each world of the game is four levels, plus a minigame-style boss round.

game.name: 1190 - Contra (J) [p1][T+Eng1.0_MadHacker]
game.info: This addendum patch fixes the missing bitmap error and a ‘corrupted’ Konami ending logo. This is an unofficial addendum patch. It should be applied on top of an already patched ROM.

game.name: 1191 - Deep Dungeon IV - Kuro no Youjutsushi (J) [T+Eng0.1_OffCourse]
game.description: Deep Dungeon IV - Kuro no Youjutsushi (J) [T+Eng0.1_OffCourse]
game.info: Way back before Dragoon-X was involved in translating Deep Dungeon IV, the translation project was originally started by Off Course Translations, consisting of Dustin Hubbard (now going by Hubz). The ROM he used to hack the game had one of those “dirty” headers that you used to see all the time back in the day, and the same ROM was used throughout the project. This means that any ROM patched with any of Off Course’s or Dragoon-X’s patches will have a “dirty” header and will not run in most modern emulators.

game.info: A full Russian translation of Earth Bound Zero for the NES. More details and media can be found at Chief-Net.ru.

game.name: 1303 - Youkai Club (Japan)
game.info: This was my first released translation. There was a minor header issue. Patch has been updated several years later with a few extra changes.

game.name: 1305 - Faxanadu (J) [!]
game.info: This is a 100% complete Dutch translation of Faxanadu!

game.name: 1306 - Elysion (J) [!]
game.info: The zip file contains two patches. Both translate the game into english, but one of them adds SRAM support in place of the game’s original 64-character password system. The patch with the original password system intact is provided should you encounter a password that does not save/load from SRAM properly.

game.name: 1307 - Storehouse No. 18 by Alexander Chudov (R) [!]
game.info: Storehouse No.18 is a Russian Sokoban clone that has many storehouses to play and even an editor to design your own storehouses. Despite the bland looking graphics, a lot of fun can be had from this game.

game.name: 131 - Dragon Ball - Shen Long no Nazo (J) [hM34]
game.description: Dragon Ball - Shen Long no Nazo (J) [hM34]
game.info: Just a warning, TransBRC’s translation isn’t great, and even borders on Suck. But it’s still a helluva better game than Dragon Power.

patch.name: Dragon Ball - Shen Long no Nazo (J) [hM34].ips

rom.name: Dragon Ball - Shen Long no Nazo (J) [hM34].nes

game.name: 1315 - Wai Wai World (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete french translation based on Dylan Robley’s English one. The hacking has been improved since the character’s names are no longer abbreviated and the title screen is translated too.

game.name: 1316 - Wai Wai World 2 - SOS!! Paseri Jou (J) [!]
game.description: Wai Wai World 2 - SOS!! Paseri Jou (J) [!]
game.info: Based on Vice Translation’s English version. French translation 100% completed.

patch.name: Wai Wai World 2 - SOS!! Paseri Jou (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Wai Wai World 2 - SOS!! Paseri Jou (J) [!].nes

game.name: 1317 - Wagyan Land (Japan)
game.info: This is a 100% french translation based on Alan Midas English one.

game.name: 1318 - Wagyan Land 2 (Japan)
game.info: This is based on Abstract Crouton Production’s English version. Everything has been translated into French even the missing GFX of the English version.

game.name: 132 - Dragon Quest III - Soshite Densetsu e... (J) (PRG0) [!]
game.description: Dragon Quest III - Soshite Densetsu e... (J) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Yep, that’s me. This was back when I first started hacking and I thought that DQ3 would be reasonably easy, sort of. Well, the weird pointer things kinda annoyed me, and real-life issues blablabla no one cares. Anyways, most of the menus are done.

patch.name: Dragon Quest III - Soshite Densetsu e... (J) (PRG0) [!].ips

rom.name: Dragon Quest III - Soshite Densetsu e... (J) (PRG0) [!].nes

game.name: 1324 - TwinBee (Japan)
game.info: This is a French translation of TwinBee for the NES.

game.name: 1325 - Moero TwinBee - Cinnamon Hakase wo Sukue! (J)
game.description: Moero TwinBee - Cinnamon Hakase wo Sukue! (J)
game.info: This game is also known as Stinger in America, but some options (like the three-player mode) were removed. This patch translates the original game in French.

patch.name: Moero TwinBee - Cinnamon Hakase wo Sukue! (J).ips

rom.name: Moero TwinBee - Cinnamon Hakase wo Sukue! (J).nes

game.name: 1326 - TwinBee 3 - Poko Poko Dai Maou (J) [!]
game.info: This is a 100% French translation based on Neo DemiForce English translation.

game.name: 1329 - Ganbare Goemon 2 (J) [!]
game.info: Finally after about two years of work, I have a complete patch for Ganbare Goemon 2.

game.name: 1339 - Gegege no Kitarou 2 - Youkai Gundan no Chousen (Japan)
game.description: Gegege no Kitarou 2 - Youkai Gundan no Chousen (Japan)
game.info: This a complete patch for GeGeGe no Kitaro 2: Yokai Gundan no Chousen. This is a very obscure game based on the popular anime series, which have never left Japanese shores. The archive also contains some info about Kitaro’s universe. This was a collaborative attempt so the information on all the authors is in readme as well.

patch.name: Gegege no Kitarou 2 - Youkai Gundan no Chousen (Japan).ips

rom.name: Gegege no Kitarou 2 - Youkai Gundan no Chousen (Japan).nes

game.name: 1341 - Kujaku Ou (J) [!]
game.info: Kujaku Ou the Peacock King, who is a young monk from Mt. Koya with the direction of his Master, is sent to investigate strange paranormal incidents taking over Japan. Equipped with magical incantations from Shingon esoteric Japanese Buddhism, he can summon fiery Fudo, merciful Kannon, stormy Indra, valiant Marishi, winged Mayu the Peacock Lord and other deities of the pantheon in this exciting visual novel. Battle evil demons from the Grand Grimoire! Rescue damsels! Features a climactic battle between the Dark Lord and the Yamata serpent, and a secret alternate ending where the hero becomes a demon. Developed from Makoto Ogino’s popular Manga. 100% complete, fixed and updated! This is the latest version!

game.name: 1353 - Crisis Force (J) [!]
game.info: This is a translation patch for an NES shooter called Crisis Force. There wasn’t really much to do except remove some Japanese on the title screen and reword a few things in the options. This game has really great graphics for an NES game and is pretty cool to boot. Check it out.

game.name: 1354 - Cosmic Epsilon (J) [!]
game.info: This is a English translation patch for a 3D-ish shooter for the Famicom. It translates a credit in the ending and fixes up what I thought was Engrish. Thanks goes out to FlashPV who came up and hacked in the graphic for the credits.

game.name: 1362 - Hokuto no Ken (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete patch for Fist of the North Star AKA Hokuto no Ken for the NES. FlashPV did some more nice graphic work for me.

game.name: 1363 - J.League Winning Goal (Japan)
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for the soccer/football game, J-League: Winning Goal for the NES.

game.name: 1364 - Mottomo Abunai Deka (J)
game.info: The game is a 2D 1-2 player side scroller. You the player control Taka or Yuuji, or both of these characters at the same time. You’ll find yourself up against many enemies of the Yakuza gang, “The Silver Stars”, and then later on leading you to corruption within the police department and to the main villain at the end. While playing the game you’ll also run into three mini-games, which are a shooting gallery, a fast paced car ride and a shootout with one of the boss enemies.

game.name: 1366 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: Zelda II, completely translated to Latin.

patch.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].nes

game.name: 1367 - Kinnikuman - Muscle Tag Match (J) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Uh, yeah. This translates the title screen and I didn’t really do anything. As usual FlashPV did the title screen for me. There are a few katakana characters that I looked for, but I couldn’t find in the game. Oh well.

game.name: 1369 - Star Wars (J) (Namco) [!]
game.info: The game is a 2D sidescrolling action game and several other missions, such as flying your X-Wing out in space, shooting at Tie Fighters, and the last mission, flying your X-Wing to take out the Death Star. I estimate that you’ll get about 45 minutes of enjoyment out of this game, should you play all the way to the end and beat the game. Probably, the most difficult area to pass in the game would be the first visit to the Death Star.

game.name: 137 - Famicom Wars (J) [!]
game.info: This is a translation patch for the NES game “Famicom Wars”. It translates the following:

game.name: 1374 - Cadillac (J) [!]
game.info: Cadillac is a puzzle card game featuring several women that try to take every last bit of money from you. The object of the game is to clear all of the cards at the end of the deck, which can be pretty tricky. During the game, you have cards that come down from the top and make their way to the bottom where you position them to make poker combinations, like three of a kind, 4 of a kind, 5 of a kind, flushes and straights. There are 10 levels to beat in this game. Your reward on a few levels is to see a full screen view of one of the women that host the game. This game is a one or two player game.

game.name: 1378 - Valkyrie no Bouken - Toki no Kagi Densetsu (Japan)
game.description: Valkyrie no Bouken - Toki no Kagi Densetsu (Japan)
game.info: DvD was trying to play through the game, but all the issues with the current translation detracted from the experience. Since the game had very little text to deal with, he decided this well known classic Namco Action RPG really needed someone to give it a more accurate translation.

patch.name: Valkyrie no Bouken - Toki no Kagi Densetsu (Japan).ips

rom.name: Valkyrie no Bouken - Toki no Kagi Densetsu (Japan).nes

game.name: 138 - Final Fantasy I & II (J) [!]
game.info: It seems that Demi simply copied over the U.S. Final Fantasy ROM as well as Neo Demiforce’s Final Fantasy II translated ROM into this one, and made a patch. It looks like it may have been copied over a little too well, as both games use the same location in RAM to save data. Meaning, saving in Final Fantasy II will erase your Final Fantasy save, and vice versa. It’s not too big of a deal with savestates, but this really isn’t something to enjoy on your copier, dig?

game.name: 1386 - Devil Man (Japan)
game.info: Go Nagai’s Devilman comes to life in this graphic and text action-adventure game for the Famicom/NES. High atop the Himalayas, ancient devils are stirring beneath the ice after ten thousand years of imprisonment. Archdemon Xenon, their four-faced master unleashes them upon the Earth much to the chagrin of humanity. You are Akira Fudo who combines with a powerful ancient demon named Amon to become Devilman! Six levels of fire, ice, water, secret demon research labs, Tokyo ruins, and much more to explore as Devilman, Akira, his friends, or girlfriend Miki! Four exciting alternate endings! Check the read-me file for the walk-through and level passwords!

game.name: 1387 - Kujaku Ou 2 (J) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation of Kujaku Ou II for the NES.

game.name: 1388 - Robocco Wars (J)
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for Robocco Wars for the NES. It translates the title screen courtesy of FlashPV, a Japanese graphic which I designed and fixes up some engrish. There also appears to be two hidden/unused stages. I would like to see if they exist, but I’m not going to pursue the possibility. Although a level select cheat might do the trick.

game.name: 1389 - Urusei Yatsura - Lum no Wedding Bell (J) [!]
game.description: Urusei Yatsura - Lum no Wedding Bell (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete patch for the NES game Urusei Yatsura Lum no Wedding Bell. It translates the title, which was designed by FlashPV, one string of Japanese text and various small graphics present throughout the game. If you notice that the game is the same as Momoko 120% for the Arcade, you’re dang right! That game was supposed to have the Urusei Yatsura license, but Jaleco failed to get it. But the theme song still plays through the game and Jaleco did manage to get the license for the NES version. Watch out for those flames.

patch.name: Urusei Yatsura - Lum no Wedding Bell (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Urusei Yatsura - Lum no Wedding Bell (J) [!].nes

game.name: 139 - Final Fantasy II (J) [!]
game.info: Oct. 20th 2010 Addendum - Parasyte’s Addendum Patch was released May. 30th 2004 and fixes the problem in modern emulators of graphic glitching instead of the fade effect. This is an unofficial addendum patch. It should be applied on top of an already patched ROM.

game.name: 1390 - Tatakae! Chou Robotto Seimeitai Transformers - Convoy no Nazo (J) [!]
game.description: Tatakae! Chou Robotto Seimeitai Transformers - Convoy no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for one of the worst games ever. One of the endings might be wacky as I only got to one of them, but it probably doesn’t matter anyway.

patch.name: Tatakae! Chou Robotto Seimeitai Transformers - Convoy no Nazo (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Tatakae! Chou Robotto Seimeitai Transformers - Convoy no Nazo (J) [!].nes

game.name: 1391 - TwinBee 3 - Poko Poko Dai Maou (J) [!]
game.info: This game was translated by Demi years ago, but the credits weren’t translated. So I asked Demi if I could use mainly his graphics for a new patch and now I have a new translation patch for you. I re-did the option menu, and used most of Demi’s graphics for this hack.

game.name: 1395 - Kyouryuu Sentai Juuranger (J)
game.info: Ahhh! After 10,000 years I’m free. It’s time to conquer Earth!

game.name: 1398 - Hello Kitty World (J)
game.info: This translation, which I believe to be far superior to the previous effort, includes the beginning and end titles as well as the names in the credits.

game.name: 140 - Final Fantasy II (J) [!]
game.info: This is one of toma’s early patches from waaaaay back in the day. I remember there being a big war on Demi’s old Rom Hack Board regarding this! Like that really cool Shadow vs. Timko war over Final Fantasy V! Anyway, Demiforce already completed the game, this patch is here only for nostalgia.

game.name: 1400 - Final Mission (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete translation for the NES shooter Final Mission. The game was released in the US and Europe, but they altered the story to something cliche and stupid and they made the difficulty easier. In their defense, the game’s not easy and requires some strategery in order to succeed.

game.name: 1402 - Power Blazer (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for the NES platformer/Megaman clone Power Blazer.

game.name: 1419 - Fudou Myouou Den (Japan)
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for Fudou Myouou Den for the NES. This game is the Japanese version of Demon Sword, which contains lots more stages, weapons and magic. Plus there’s a cool Buddhist intro/outro. Thanks to snark for translating the Siddham and FlashpV for doing some graphic work.

game.name: 142 - Final Fantasy III (J) [!]
game.info: This is some of toma’s early handiwork, here for nostalgic purposes. It’s incomplete, of course… But, hey! Someone might want to check it out, it’s a part of history, man!

game.name: 143 - Final Fantasy III (J) [!]
game.info: Another old and incomplete Final Fantasy 3 patch, this one by AkIlLa^ (whom I think went on to code the NES emulator NES4PC). Of course, you’re better off with AWJ’s patch, because this one doesn’t translate much and is here for completion’s sake.

game.name: 144 - Final Fantasy III (J) [!]
game.info: Good God, is this patch old. Thankfully Nightcrawler grew up and started putting out some quality releases. Hah! Anyway, this is just here for completion’s sake, and is not to be messed with except for fun and giggles and stuff.

game.name: 1444 - Jajamaru Gekimaden - Maboroshi no Kinmajou (J) [!]
game.info: After a few months of work, aishsha and I have complete translation patch for Jajamaru Gekimaden. We have translated the title as Ninja Jajamaru: Legend of the Demon’s Attack - Castle of Dreams. Hopefully the patch should be without issues.

game.name: 1445 - Fire Emblem Gaiden (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete translation of Fire Emblem Gaiden, possibly one of the last in the series needing a full translation.

game.name: 1448 - Ninja Jajamaru-kun (J) [!]
game.info: This was a quick and easy hack by me and Aishasha. Not really much to say other than Aishasha’s title screen is probably better than the game itself. But it’s a real simple platformer.

game.name: 1449 - Kaguya Hime Densetsu (J) [!]
game.info: The Moon Princess Legend! The original game is Kaguya Hime Densetsu c. 1988 Victor Musical Interactive, licensed for Famicom / Nintendo. This title translates as “Moon Princess Legend” based on the Bamboo Cutter’s Tale. You are a young woodsman armed with only a whip, a candle, and the words of a mysterious angel. A Moon Princess has landed upon Earth, and hides inside a glowing bamboo stalk within an enchanted forest. You must seek the hand of the Moon Princess who can only be saved by magical orb that is guarded by a fierce dragon. Saunter through silly side-quests and goofy misadventures! This is a text and graphics adventure with minor side-scrolling arcade sequences. Several surprise endings and three difficulty levels!

game.name: 145 - Fire Emblem - Ankoku Ryuu to Hikari no Tsurugi (J) [!]
game.description: Fire Emblem - Ankoku Ryuu to Hikari no Tsurugi (J) [!]
game.info: This still has quite a ways to go, but hey - all the menu text and a goodly chunk of battle text is done, as well as all the dialogue text for Chapter 1 (of 25). Ooh, and the font is pretty spiffy, too. So yay.

patch.name: Fire Emblem - Ankoku Ryuu to Hikari no Tsurugi (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Fire Emblem - Ankoku Ryuu to Hikari no Tsurugi (J) [!].nes

game.name: 1451 - Contra (J) [!]
game.info: This is a new patch for the Japanese version of Contra. This project has nothing in common with the old patch by the MadHacker. I do not mean to insult the old patch, but I wanted to show just how far ROM hacking has come in the past ten years.

game.name: 1453 - Maharaja (Japan)
game.info: Maharajah! This is the BETA translation patch for Maharaja c. 1989 Sunsoft Famicom/NES adventure RPG. Venture through time to ancient India in this exciting text and graphic RPG! The wicked sorceror Indrajeet is conjuring the demon Ravana who threatens the cosmos, the princess, and all of humanity. Taraka, a great demon and his three sons guard the pieces to a divine weapon that can defeat Ravana. With magic weapons, mantras, and Shiva at your side defeat demons and wild beasts in jungles and ruined palaces!

game.name: 146 - Fire Emblem Gaiden (J) [!]
game.info: July 5th 2007 Addendum - Starwolfs’s Addendum Patch was released Feb 11, 2006. This is a reparation which fixes various issues with J2E’s translation patch. This is an unofficial addendum patch. It should be applied on top of an already patched ROM.

game.name: 1461 - Captain Silver (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for the NES game Captain Silver. Some people find this game to be rather bad, but I’m here to tell you that they’re wrong. This game is a shining star of excellence with great gameplay, great music and greatest of all is the game’s story marvelously translated by Eien ni Hen.

game.name: 1466 - Juuryoku Soukou Metal Storm (J) [!]
game.info: This is a 100% complete translation of Juuryoku Soukou Metal Storm, which is the Japanese release of the game called “Metal Storm” in North America.

game.name: 147 - Taiyou no Yuusha Firebird (J) [!]
game.info: This new patch version 1.01 by Dragoon-X translates a lot more stuff, giving this a true 100% completion mark. There’s still some weird color changes in the text sometimes, though they were there in the original rom. Why didn’t the programmers mess with that? Oh well.

game.name: 148 - Hokuto no Ken 2 - Seikimatsu Kyuuseishu Densetsu (J) [!]
game.description: Hokuto no Ken 2 - Seikimatsu Kyuuseishu Densetsu (J) [!]
game.info: This patch translates quite a bit (well, there’s not much TO translate), like the status bar and some stage names. But I still wouldn’t try it out if I were you.

patch.name: Hokuto no Ken 2 - Seikimatsu Kyuuseishu Densetsu (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Hokuto no Ken 2 - Seikimatsu Kyuuseishu Densetsu (J) [!].nes

game.name: 1485 - Sqoon (J) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for the Japanese version of Sqoon. There are few textual differences between versions of the game, but nothing major.

game.name: 1486 - Hi no Tori - Houou Hen - Gaou no Bouken (J) [!]
game.description: Hi no Tori - Houou Hen - Gaou no Bouken (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for Phoenix - Gao’s Adventure.

patch.name: Hi no Tori - Houou Hen - Gaou no Bouken (J) [!].bps

rom.name: Hi no Tori - Houou Hen - Gaou no Bouken (J) [!].nes

game.name: 149 - Fuzzical Fighter (J) [!]
game.info: What’s to say? It looks great! Just play the damn game already.

game.name: 1496 - Ganbare Goemon! - Karakuri Douchuu (J) [!]
game.info: Finally, a complete version of the first Famicom Goemon. This patch has a whole new translation, the map screens have been translated, all 8 ending messages are inserted and all known mistakes were fixed.

game.name: 150 - Ganbare Goemon! - Karakuri Douchuu (Japan)
game.info: This was released about three years ago, and it was just now discovered that the ending was not translated. So here’s a new patch, with a translated ending! Kueller no longer has FTP access to his site, so you won’t see it there. Sorry.

game.name: 1500 - Castle Quest (J) [!]
game.info: Castle Quest is basically a pretty neat chess knockoff for the NES with RPG battles. Each piece has its own attributes and magic powers. You move the pieces around the chessboard and when they land on each other they go into a battle. Each piece then takes turns with cards, if the card rolled is higher than the opponents defense you will do damage, if not you will miss and lose a turn. Magic plays a huge role as well as it can be used on the chessboard to wreck havoc or heal your own units. The game is a lot of luck but also a lot of strategy too especially when it comes to magic.

game.name: 1503 - Kunio-kun no Nekketsu Soccer League (J) [!]
game.info: Finally I was able to fix text appearance order, now I need some more time to deal with untranslated parts. The project is alive don’t worry! Cheer!

game.name: 151 - Getsufuu Maden (J) [!]
game.info: Everything’s complete for the most part, but things definitely feel like a 1998 translation. NPCs have only one line of text available on-screen, so anything being spoken to you is divided up by a handful of words at a time. It makes for some very stilted conversation (as well as some difficult screenshot-taking).

game.name: 1512 - Werewolf - The Last Warrior (U) [!]
game.info: Version 2.0 of the translation is 100% playable and translated, everything was translated including graphs where ØX-Carnage had to remap the tiles and redo maps. ØX-Carnage want to thank the friends of the forum RHDN who guided and helped his friend Knirt with attribute tables.

game.name: 1519 - Ankoku Shinwa - Yamato Takeru Densetsu (J) [!]
game.info: Ankoku Shinwa - The Dark Myth for Famicom NES c. 1988 Original Story and Game Design c. Tokyo Shoseki and Daijiro Moroboshi BETA Translation patch by Snark. (word bank names are truncated/ title screen unchanged) c. 2010 An exciting murder mystery with esoteric Buddhism and Japanese history and legend. 1600 years ago Yamato the Brave dressed in woman’s disguise defeated the Kumaso chief, who swore vengeance upon Yamato and His descendants. 1600 years later, the Dark God and his minions are manifesting to fill Kumaso’s curse. You are Takeshi, Yamato’s descendent, a young man, who sets out to solve his father’s murder at the hands of a mysterious assailant. Your goal is to receive the eight chakra marks of the Serpent from the God Brahma,retrieve mystical items of the past, and fight horrifying Minions in order to solve the murder in this graphic and text adventure.

game.name: 1523 - Kunio-kun no Nekketsu Soccer League (J) [!]
game.info: This patch translated everything into Spanish, but with some limitations due to lack of space in the ROM and minor glitches. The important thing is that it captured the essential translation and that is what counts. I should clarify that the translation was based on the English translation by Pentarou Zero.

game.name: 1524 - Kunio-kun no Nekketsu Soccer League (J) [!]
game.info: Kunio Kun No Nekketsu Soccer League AKA “Battle Soccer 2″ (NES) by Technos Japan Corp. The Japanese version of one of most killer games of this series + Patch 90% of Russification! [Rus]: Dee-moN / rUSSIANrOMS 2:5054 / 34.50 @ FidoNet

game.name: 1525 - Kunio-kun no Nekketsu Soccer League (J) [!]
game.info: This simplified Chinese for the Chinese Version of the game, from irritability + Air Team finished.

game.name: 1527 - Adventures of Lolo 3 (U) [!]
game.info: A patch for the last episode of The adventures of Lolo. Everything should be translated in french.

game.name: 153 - Herakles no Eikou - Toujin Makyou Den (J) [!]
game.description: Herakles no Eikou - Toujin Makyou Den (J) [!]
game.info: This patch only translates the menus.

patch.name: Herakles no Eikou - Toujin Makyou Den (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Herakles no Eikou - Toujin Makyou Den (J) [!].nes

game.name: 1535 - Just Breed (J) [!]
game.info: This translation is awesome. Thanks to Bongo`’s hacking, and Shih Tzu’s translation. Now you can enjoy an Spanish version of this game, all start soon after Bongo’s released his first patch translating this game, I was so delight with this game that I decided to translate it myself from English to Spanish, so I send a few emails to Bongo’ and Shih Tzu and later this translations became true :)

game.name: 1539 - Jigoku Gokuraku Maru (J)
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for Jigoku Gokuraku Maru. Without the help of Eien Ni Hen, Paul Jensen and DarknessSavior this patch would not have been possible.

game.name: 154 - Herakles no Eikou II - Titan no Metsubou (J) [!]
game.description: Herakles no Eikou II - Titan no Metsubou (J) [!]
game.info: Toma did an excellent job with this one. The font is really nifty-looking, and the script is well-written. So, um, play it, and hurray!

patch.name: Herakles no Eikou II - Titan no Metsubou (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Herakles no Eikou II - Titan no Metsubou (J) [!].nes

game.name: 1540 - Grand Master (J)
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for the NES action RPG Grand Master. It was a joint effort between myself and aishsha.

game.name: 1542 - Insector X (J) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation of Insector X for the NES.

game.name: 1543 - B-Wings (J) [!]
game.info: This patch translates the ending making it very complete.

game.name: 1544 - Dragon Ninja (Japan)
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for Dragon Ninja, the Japanese version of Bad Dudes.

game.name: 1546 - Nekketsu! Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes (J)
game.description: Nekketsu! Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes (J)
game.info: This is an unfinished and dead Korean translation of “Nekketsu Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes”.

patch.name: Nekketsu! Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes (J).ips

rom.name: Nekketsu! Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes (J).nes

game.name: 1547 - Nekketsu! Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes (J)
game.description: Nekketsu! Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes (J)
game.info: Nekketsu! Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes - a game. Just a game. It can not be attributed to any genre, are all genres here are mixed together in unbelievable proportions. The game includes all the best features from the previous games in this series (football, hockey), plus it involved quite a lot of original ideas - which is only the ability for four to play! The full English version of this game does not exist, so the accuracy of this Russian translation is not 100% guaranteed. However, I can state: the translation keeps the original atmosphere intact. Onward! To wild basketball the world has never seen!

game.info: The MadHacker calls this Gryzor, for reasons mentioned in the readme. I’d go with Gryzor too, if nothing more than the fact that it has a cooler title screen.

game.name: 1551 - Contra (J) [!]
game.info: This was finished back in ‘09, but some unforeseen circumstances occurred in November & everything was dropped. When I picked the project up again, I realized everything was already finished.

game.name: 1553 - Kunio-kun no Nekketsu Soccer League (J) [!]
game.info: This is an Arabic translation of great “Kunio Kun no Nekketsu Soccer League”, translated by Hisoka and Glow Trans. I couldn’t find any readme file for this patch.

game.name: 1554 - Mad City (J) [!]
game.info: This is complete translation patch for Mad City, the Japanese version of Bayou Billy. The game is much easier and features more content than its American counterpart. It’s near perfect, so enjoy.

game.name: 1555 - Captain Tsubasa Vol. II - Super Striker (J) [!]
game.description: Captain Tsubasa Vol. II - Super Striker (J) [!]
game.info: The first release of this patch was released by Adnan (ExtraOrdinary). In that version, the letter spacing throughout the game was far apart from each other, but in version 2, this issue was fixed. The advantage of this patch over Mahmood S. Lattouf’s patch is that Adnan has fixed the text appearance order.

rom.name: Captain Tsubasa Vol. II - Super Striker (J) [!].nes

game.info: Neo Demiforce’s Final Fantasy II English Translation Titlescreen Fix

game.name: 157 - Hello Kitty World (J)
game.info: A ton of people worked on this game, but this is I guess the “official” site right here. InVerse did most of the hacking stuff I think, and basically all of the distribution stuff. See, InVerse wasn’t always bad!

game.name: 1571 - Jekyll Hakase no Houma ga Toki (Japan)
game.description: Jekyll Hakase no Houma ga Toki (Japan)

rom.name: Jekyll Hakase no Houma ga Toki (Japan).nes

game.name: 1578 - Banana (J) [!]
game.info: This is a puzzle game for the NES. Help Mr. Mole find his way through the maze, save Keyko the girl and get to the door.

game.name: 158 - Hello Kitty no Ohanabatake (J)
game.info: All that needed doing here was the title screen and some miscellaneous graphics. Needless to say, it didn’t take long, Um, let’s just leave it at that.

game.name: 1582 - Magic John (J) [!]
game.info: This is a translation of Magic John, the Japanese version of Totally Rad. Those who have played Totally Rad may remember Jaleco rewrote the script to sound “cooler”, resulting in a script that was almost instantly hilariously outdated. …although Shih Tzu does commend them for at least turning it into SOMETHING memorable, as the Japanese script was kinda bland.

game.name: 159 - Hottaaman no Chitei Tanken (J) [!]
game.info: I don’t think much needed to be translated here. On another note, isn’t the new title screen sweet? InVerse did some seriously great work here. Hurray.

game.name: 1590 - Final Fantasy III (J) [!]
game.info: This is an alternate translation of the Famicom version of Final Fantasy III that isn’t as widespread as AWJ’s patch. It appears to be fully playable - the key difference between this translation and the other one is that the resulting ROM has an expanded size. This leads to generally more accurate dialog. However, the author also made some of the names more literal - which is either a good thing or a bad thing, depending on how you look at it. I guess you just can’t win.

game.name: 1591 - Spelunker II - Yuusha e no Chousen (Japan)
game.description: Spelunker II - Yuusha e no Chousen (Japan)
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for Spelunker 2, which was translated back in 2003, but it wasn’t the greatest of translations. This patch has almost nothing to do with the old one and is much better all around. Retranslation provided kindly by Paul Jensen.

patch.name: Spelunker II - Yuusha e no Chousen (Japan).ips

rom.name: Spelunker II - Yuusha e no Chousen (Japan).nes

game.name: 1593 - Fire Emblem - Ankoku Ryuu to Hikari no Tsurugi (J) [!]
game.description: Fire Emblem - Ankoku Ryuu to Hikari no Tsurugi (J) [!]
game.info: This is a full translation of Fire Emblem: Ankoku Ryu to Hikari no Tsurugi for the NES. Join Prince Marth on his journey to liberate the continent of Akaneia.

patch.name: Fire Emblem - Ankoku Ryuu to Hikari no Tsurugi (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Fire Emblem - Ankoku Ryuu to Hikari no Tsurugi (J) [!].nes

game.name: 160 - Jajamaru Gekimaden - Maboroshi no Kinmajou (J) [!]
game.info: Yeah, this is by me. This patch isn’t bad for about 3 hours worth of work, but my opinion is biased ^_^. Anyway, it inserts an English font into the game, translates most of the Load/Delete/Copy game menu, and the name input screen. Oh yeah, and the status screen, too ^_^. It should be useful enough to try the game and get a feel for it. As far as dialogue goes, this game patch is currently useless =[. I was supposed to work on this with Mage from J2e Translations, but as far as I can tell, he hasn’t even been online for a while now. He told me he had a translator, but obviously, if I can’t talk to him, I can’t talk to his translator. I don’t speak Japanese, so no translator=no translation. But it’s kinda moot anyway, I lost most of my work and can’t remember how the pointers work or anything, anyway. If someone wants to use this patch as starting point for their own translation, feel free.

game.name: 1603 - Tao (Japan)
game.info: The Sci-fi mystical RPG set in a post apocalyptic world, where a young man unravels a mystery regarding his origins and attempts to thwart an Nostradamus-tinged apocalypse that begins as a meteorite slams into his hometown. Find eight pieces of a trigram, 7 chakra statues and 7 amulets of the star lords in 7 mystic cities while fighting a cast of bizarre demons and gods!

game.name: 1604 - Dragon Ball - Dai Maou Fukkatsu (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for the second Dragon Ball game on the NES.

game.name: 161 - Joy Mech Fight (J) [!]
game.info: Umm, the translation is complete, and looks really cool! Oh, and the title screen rocks! Yeah!

game.name: 1620 - Tetris (U) [!]
game.info: Covers everything apart from the licensing screen at the start, which is why the patch is 0.99 complete at the most, but is fully playable in Turkish.

game.name: 1621 - Parodius Da! (Japan)
game.info: This is a complete translation patch for Parodius da! This game was released in Europe, but the very entertaining ending theme song was removed. This has been rectified for this release.

game.name: 1626 - Felix the Cat (U) [!]
game.info: This is a Felix the Cat (English to Spanish) translation. Also three years between translation and release! Most graphics and text have been translated.

game.name: 1627 - TaleSpin (U) [!]
game.info: Spanish translation of NES game SpinTales, its about 90%, so… enjoy it!

game.name: 163 - Just Breed (J) [!]
game.info: What this patch currently translates is most of the menus, some monster names, and small hodge-podge of other random stuff.

game.name: 1640 - Mickey Mouse III - Yume Fuusen (J) [!]
game.info: Once upon a time there was a series of Mickey Mouse games on the original Nintendo. Most were translated faithfully, but a few were altered due to licensing agreements. Mickey Mouse III - Dream Balloon (aka: Yume Fuusen) was one such game - in English-speaking countries it was called “Kid Klown”, with (in my opinion) rather hideous graphic changes and a completely different story. This patch translates the game into English, so you can see what Disney felt they weren’t being paid enough in 1992 to show you. (*Yes there’s a prototype version that was translated, but the English was pretty terrible*)

game.name: 1645 - Jikuu Yuuden - Debias (Japan)
game.info: Originally titled Jikuu Yuuden Debias, now retitled to be named Debias: Legendary Space-Time Hero. Which is a action RPG originally released by Namco.

game.name: 1679 - Bloody Warriors - Shan-Go no Gyakushuu (J) [!]
game.info: This is a full patch for Bloody Warriors. The gameplay is like a Dragon Quest clone. This game is set in ancient times and has a few unique properties. In addition to turn based battles, you will face strategy battles also. You can buy and recruit troops for those battles. Almost no text had to be cut out to make this a high quality translation. No rom expansion will be necessary to apply the patch. This patch can be applied with any ips patch program.

game.info: This is mostly translated, but it wouldn’t be that hard for a platform game like this. There is some stuff that hasn’t been touched, like the between-level stuff. But basically, you can get by with this patch. It’ll work. And I don’t think another release will be out, judging by the readme.

game.info: This is an action/adventure game designed by Japanese comedian Takeshi Kitano. It is rather infamous because it’s a pretty terrible game, but perhaps it was intentionally bad as some kind of prank on the player.

game.name: 172 - Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque - La Legende d'Or (F) [!]
game.description: Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque - La Legende d'Or (F) [!]
game.info: The translation is also very weird, though you have to admit the font rocks. A lot of stuff doesn’t make any sense, mostly because the game’s so damn confusing, but also because the game gives no indication of who is speaking at any one time, which is a LOT more frustrating than you may think. This may be the game’s fault though, or maybe different characters have different distinguishing dialects, or hell I dunno. In short, it ain’t pretty, but it’s in English and the font rocks.

game.name: 1723 - Nakayoshi to Issho (J)
game.info: This is an English translation for a beginner-level RPG based on Nakayoshi Magazine. Nakayoshi Magazine is a Japanese publication that specializes in shoujo (”girl”) manga. Several worlds exist in this game based on various manga that have appeared in that magazine, most notably Sailor Moon. The game also has worlds based on a bunch of manga that never saw official English releases, such as Goldfish Warning!, Pocket Park, MinMin!, Taiyou ni Smash and Kurumi and the Seven Dwarfs.

game.name: 173 - Wai Wai World (J) [!]

That patch from back then was for the FFE hack of the game, and that’s bad, so another patch was released a few months later for the good rom. But, it was missing some stuff that was in the FFE translation, so the patch was quietly updated on the homepage with no version change or anything. This patch is also mysteriously missing from the Demiforce website right now, but trust me, this translation actually did happen.

It has been tested on the PowerPak and works flawlessly with the latest mapper files.

game.name: 200 - Yume Penguin Monogatari (J)
game.info: First of all, kalevan made a mistake when updating his patch to version 2. He included two patches, one for the clean Japanese rom, and one for the rom that had already been patched with the version 1 translation. The mistake is, both patches are identical, meaning that unless you have a previously patched Penguin Dream Story rom, you’re out of luck. Fortunately I have solved the problem and replaced the IPS in the zip file. A Whirlpool exclusive! Now pengv2.ips will correctly patch an original Japanese rom.

game.name: 206 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: The only truly significant change here from the original American release is the change from “Crashman” to “Clashman”. Which is ridiculous; neither name makes any sense. The only place “Clashman” appears in the entire series is in Megaman 2 for Gameboy, which had a pretty bad translation anyways. Well aside from that, there’s no real reason to prefer this over the American release, just some slight rewordings. At least the American release has an easier difficulty mode.

Despite what the readme says, only the intro has been done; nothing else was touched. This does use the American names though, so get it if you’re into that kind of stuff.

game.name: 216 - Square no Tom Sawyer (J) [!]
game.info: Kikuyama’s native language (I’m pretty sure, anyway) is Swedish, and it really shows in this translation. Not a whole lot has been done, just basically the prologue and some menus, along with scattered dialogue. It’s odd, because I remember Toma talking a long time ago about how the text in this game was compressed. Well anyway, don’t expect too much from this. This patch used to include both the patch and the already-patched ROM, but for legal reasons only the patch is in this one. Deal.

So the smallish percentage of stuff that IS done is kinda hard to read, cause you have to tilt your head to one side and stuff. Anyway, all the hiragana is translated, all the kanji is not.

game.info: This latest release (1.01) fixes the ending credits and some glitches, and includes some save states for various NES emulators. Save states, you ask? Well, the intro for this game (even the untranslated original) has trouble in a lot of emulators. InVerse included save states for the most popular emulators of the time, so you can use those to bypass the intro. Unfortunately nobody uses those emulators anymore, but current emulators shouldn’t have a problem running the game.

game.info: This is the complete translation for the Chinese game Chik Bik Ji Jin - Saam Gwok Ji for NES. The game title translates to “Three Kingdoms - Battle of Red Cliffs”. It is the NES version of the Arcade game “Warriors of Fate”. The game is based off of the famous Chinese history based novel “Romance of the Three Kingdoms”. You can play as one of three generals whose mission is to stop the evil Cao Cao and his army. You can also play co-op with a friend as well!

game.info: This is yet another The Legend of Zelda translation into Spanish, but this one’s different! It’s been made to look like just an official translation released in Spain. The new script translation has been done thanks to the 2003 re-release (which fortunately was better written) and Legends of Localization’s exhaustive translation analysis. This includes hints properly indicated and credits staff names reverted to their real ones. Please enjoy this translation and don’t hesitate to contact me if you find any errors or issues!

game.name: 2249 - 4 Nin Uchi Mahjong (J) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation patch for 4 Player Strike Mahjong (also known as 4 Nin Uchi Mahjong) for the Famicom. Developed by Hudson Soft and published in 1984 by Nintendo, it’s a port of an earlier computer game named Jankyou (”Mahjong Enthusiast”) and is one of the simplest games available for the system. It is a straight-forward implementation of Japanese mahjong where (despite the name) a single player competes against three AI opponents.

Anyway, this patch was dedicated to Sardu and Bloodlust Software, since version 0.42 of NESticle was able to play the game flawlessly (and also turned out to be the last release). From the start it’s obvious that Demi translated it, since you’ll see various things like “k” and “oh!” as you’re flying around. That kinda stuff was really cool in Konami World, but it just seems out of place here. Oh well, enough bitching. Have fun with the game, and somebody let me know if it’s finished or not.

game.name: 2382 - Hana no Star Kaidou (J) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation patch for Hana no Star Kaidou (”Flowering Star Highway”), a game released for the Nintendo Famicom in 1987 by Victor Music Industries (now known as Victor Entertainment). As might be expected from a music company, this game is about two teen-aged Japanese performers trying to make it big in the music industry. As might also be expected from a music company, this game isn’t very good.

game.name: 2385 - Ike Ike! Nekketsu Hockey-bu - Subette Koronde Dai Rantou (J) [!]
game.description: Ike Ike! Nekketsu Hockey-bu - Subette Koronde Dai Rantou (J) [!]
game.info: Around 15 years ago, an English translation for Ike Ike! Nekketsu Hockey-bu was created by the group Disconnected Translations. Unfortunately, for most of that time, contemporary Famicom emulators have been unable to play it due to a game-breaking bug that was introduced by the patch; namely, once a goal is scored, the game freezes while trying to display the scoreboard. This patch fixes that bug, among others, making the game 100% playable on current emulators (or at least FCEUX, which is what it was tested on).

game.name: 2471 - Ganso Saiyuuki - Super Monkey Daibouken (J) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation patch for Ganso Saiyuuki: Super Monkey Daibouken (”Original Journey to the West: Super Monkey Adventure”), a game released for the Nintendo Famicom in 1987 by VAP. As the name suggests, it’s an adventure game of sorts based on the classic Chinese novel, Journey to the West. In it, you have to guide Son Goku and his band of pilgrims across Asia to the mystical land of India, where the Buddha awaits to show them the way to total enlightenment. On the way, there are a number of obstacles, including the game’s soul-crushingly low movement speed and bad hit detection. Chrontendo named this game the worst game released for the system before 1988, beating out such luminaries as Takeshi no Chousenjou and Hoshi wo Miru Hito.

game.name: 2479 - Duck Hunt (W) [!]
game.info: Here is the fully translated version in English to Hungarian the Duck Hunt. Have a fun! :)

game.name: 2492 - Musashi no Ken - Tadaima Shugyou Chuu (J) [!]
game.description: Musashi no Ken - Tadaima Shugyou Chuu (J) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation patch for Musashi no Ken: Tadaima Shugyou Chuu (”Musashi’s Sword: Now in Training”), a platformer for the Nintendo Famicom released by Taito in 1986. It is based on the anime adaptation of Musashi no Ken, an ’80s coming-of-age shounen manga about the son of two kendo masters and his trials and exploits through his childhood and high-school years. This game takes place in his early life and has you racing your pet dog through three platforming levels while dispatching various creatures and obstacles with your kendo sword. After powering yourself up in these levels, you move on to a kendo tournament where you compete against your rivals in a simplistic fighting-game format. Like most platformers that came out immediately after Super Mario Bros., Musashi no Ken is a pretty rough game, with floaty controls and ceaselessly spawning enemies.

patch.name: Musashi no Ken - Tadaima Shugyou Chuu (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Musashi no Ken - Tadaima Shugyou Chuu (J) [!].nes

game.name: 2499 - Super Star Force (J) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation patch for Super Star Force, a shoot-’em-up developed and published by Tecmo in 1986 for the Nintendo Famicom. It was the sequel to the earlier Star Force, which was an endless vertical shmup that was massively popular in Japanese arcades and was also released in America to less success. Unlike its predecessor, Super Star Force has an in-game plot and two possible endings, is somewhat non-linear, and includes Zelda-like on-foot sequences and NPC encounters. All of this makes it highly similar to the later NES game The Guardian Legend, though Super Star Force does not quite reach that level of quality.

game.name: 3073 - Gomoku Narabe (Japan)
game.info: This is a full 100% translation of Gomoku Narabe Renju. Released on 27th August 1983, it was only the joint fourth game ever released on Famicom, along with Mahjong on the same day. It’s based on the Japanese board game Gomoku Narabe, meaning Five in a Row, and it’s also known as Gobang in the West. The Renju subtitle refers to the professional rules that make the game more difficult for the black player (who always goes first) thus making the chance of victory more even for both players.
