rom.name: Ganbare Goemon Gaiden - Kieta Ougon Kiseru (Japan).nes

game.name: 3082 - Ninja Crusaders (U) [!]
game.info: Translation to spanish for “Ninja Crusaders”, for the Nintendo Entertainment System.

game.name: 3091 - Twin Cobra (U) [!]
game.info: Translation for “Twin Cobra” for the Nintendo Entertainment System.

game.name: 3102 - Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk (J) [!]
game.description: Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk (J) [!]
game.info: This is a 100% English translation of Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk. The introduction, title screen, password system and all non-player character dialogue has been translated, and the originally English ending has been corrected to fix errors in spelling, vocabulary and grammar.

patch.name: Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk (J) [!].nes

game.name: 3108 - Time Zone (J) [!]
game.info: Translation to Spanish for “Time Zone” dor the Nintendo Entertainment System. Based on the English translation by King Mike Translations.

game.name: 3112 - Mahjong (J) (REVA) [!]
game.info: This is a 100% English translation of Mahjong for the Famicom (NES). All Japanese text has been either translated or transliterated, therefore some knowledge of mahjong terminology is required.

game.name: 3114 - Nagagutsu wo Haita Neko - Sekai Isshuu 80 Nichi Daibouken (J) [!]
game.description: Nagagutsu wo Haita Neko - Sekai Isshuu 80 Nichi Daibouken (J) [!]
game.info: This is a 100% English translation of Nagagutsu wo Haita Neko - Sekai Isshuu 80 Nichi Daibouken for the Famicom (NES). The only Japanese text present in the game is the title screen and a kanji in-game that represents ‘day’. Both of these were translated (the new title is Puss In Boots - Around The World In 80 Days), and some English spelling errors in the game were also corrected.

patch.name: Nagagutsu wo Haita Neko - Sekai Isshuu 80 Nichi Daibouken (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Nagagutsu wo Haita Neko - Sekai Isshuu 80 Nichi Daibouken (J) [!].nes

game.name: 3121 - Twin Eagle - Revenge Joe's Brother (U) [!]
game.info: Translation to Spanish for “Twin Eagle: Revenge Joe’s Brother” for the Nintendo Entertainment System.

game.name: 3132 - Hon Shougi - Naitou 9 Dan Shougi Hiden (J) [!]
game.description: Hon Shougi - Naitou 9 Dan Shougi Hiden (J) [!]
game.info: This is a 100% English translation of Hon Shougi - Naitou 9 Dan Shougi Hiden for the Famicom (NES), which has been renamed in this patch to Modern Shogi - Naito 9-Dan Shogi Secret. All Japanese text in the game has been translated.

patch.name: Hon Shougi - Naitou 9 Dan Shougi Hiden (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Hon Shougi - Naitou 9 Dan Shougi Hiden (J) [!].nes

game.name: 3133 - Mississippi Satsujin Jiken (J) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation patch for Mississippi Satsujin Jiken, the Famicom port of a Western 8-bit computer game named Murder on the Mississippi.

game.name: 3148 - Beauty and the Beast (E) [!]
game.info: Translation to Spanish for “Beauty and the Beast”, for the NES.

game.name: 524 - Egypt (J) [!]
game.info: This is now fully translated. Yay!

game.name: 545 - Zombie Hunter (J) [!]
game.info: Everything’s translated except for that voice that chastises you whenever you die. Which happens a lot. Yeah, the game has synthesized voices in a couple places. It’s pretty kewl.

game.name: 549 - Dragon Ball 3 - Gokuu Den (J) [!]
game.info: This patch features translates about half the items, some of the battle dialog, the introduction, menus, and features a new and improved font, and 100% less Extreme Fun Translations involvement. This patch is just a teaser of a beta, and still needs a lot of work.

game.name: 565 - Ganbare Goemon! - Karakuri Douchuu (J) [hFFE]
game.info: This patch will only work for the FFE hack of the game. Not all of it is translated, but I’ve never played enough of it to see what’s been left out. You can try out Spinner 8’s complete patch though.

game.name: 566 - Just Breed (J) [!]
game.info: If you downloaded an earlier patch from somewhere else, be sure to get the new one that fixes a menu crash later in the game.

game.name: 569 - Kunio-kun no Nekketsu Soccer League (J) [!]
game.info: Well, as far as everybody knows, there is no Japanese left in this game. It’s definitely playable, all the menus and such are in english and readable. However, the nitpicky-ness in me must point out the non-menu stuff sounds kind of odd, and there are plenty abbreviations which seem to be the result of a lack of screen real estate. Given that fixing all that would require major-league reprogramming, you can’t totally knock PentarouZero for it. In short – it’s playable.

game.name: 576 - Magical Kid's Doropie (Japan)
game.info: Here you go. Magical Doropie, translated and unedited, unlike that Krion Conquest localization. See more about that in the Readme, it’s interesting stuff. Other than that, download the patch and enjoy.

game.name: 584 - Metal Max (J) [!]
game.info: The kanji interface thingy’s done and the font’s been replaced in this patch. That’s all though.

game.name: 586 - Uchuusen - Cosmo Carrier (J) [hFFE]
game.info: Well, this is a good early start. The menus seem English enough for me to deem them navigable, and the system messages are English enough to know what’s going on. There’s a few odd spelling errors and mis-translations, though – but hey, it’s alright. That’s why it’s a beta and not a final release.

game.name: 595 - Tatakae! Chou Robotto Seimeitai Transformers - Convoy no Nazo (J) [!]
game.description: Tatakae! Chou Robotto Seimeitai Transformers - Convoy no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This translation patch only changes the title screen in the game. This may or may not have the ending done and has not been verified.

patch.name: Tatakae! Chou Robotto Seimeitai Transformers - Convoy no Nazo (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Tatakae! Chou Robotto Seimeitai Transformers - Convoy no Nazo (J) [!].nes

game.name: 596 - Downtown - Nekketsu Koushin Kyoku - Soreyuke Daiundoukai (J) [!]
game.description: Downtown - Nekketsu Koushin Kyoku - Soreyuke Daiundoukai (J) [!]
game.info: You officially know as much about this patch as I do. Jiji’s website is (apparently) long gone, so there’s no info on this patch. Hell it might even have a readme somewhere, I just kinda found this patch at RPGd, even though they say that Ballz translated it. At least, the intro setup stuff is done, so you can get through a race without encountering the accursed gibberish.

patch.name: Downtown - Nekketsu Koushin Kyoku - Soreyuke Daiundoukai (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Downtown - Nekketsu Koushin Kyoku - Soreyuke Daiundoukai (J) [!].nes

game.name: 615 - Ninja Jajamaru - Ginga Daisakusen (J) [!]
game.info: Well, this is a platformer that isn’t text-laden. But a stupendous job was done of the text that was present, thanks to HTI. Not much more to comment on, so just go get the patch already and try it.

game.name: 619 - Kaijuu Monogatari (Japan)
game.info: This is a complete translation aside from a few minor graphical glitches. It uses the Namcot 106 mapper (iNES mapper #19). The patch works only on the properly dumped Japanese ROM. I believe this is Kaijyu Monogatari (J). You will need to expand the Japanese ROM from 256KB to 384KB before applying the patch. Consult the readme for further information.

game.name: 620 - Summer Carnival '92 - Recca (J) [!]
game.info: I…Mean…DAY-AMN. HUGE BOSSES!

game.name: 634 - Hikari no Senshi Photon - The Ultimate Game on Planet Earth (J) [f1]
game.description: Hikari no Senshi Photon - The Ultimate Game on Planet Earth (J) [f1]
game.info: Everything is translated, but KingMike plans on going back later and expanding the windows to fit in bigger words and stuff. This may or may not actually happen however.

patch.name: Hikari no Senshi Photon - The Ultimate Game on Planet Earth (J) [f1].ips

rom.name: Hikari no Senshi Photon - The Ultimate Game on Planet Earth (J) [f1].nes

game.name: 635 - Wagyan Land 2 (Japan)
game.info: While this isn’t quite as polished as AlanMidas’s translation of the first Wagyan Land game (the title screen, for instance, and the GYA syllables that he shoots out are left in Japanese), it’s still all in English, and pretty damn fun to play. You can just pretend those projectiles are magical, uh, runes, or something.

game.name: 642 - Bio Senshi Dan - Increaser Tono Tatakai (J) [!]
game.description: Bio Senshi Dan - Increaser Tono Tatakai (J) [!]
game.info: Make sure you’re using an original Japanese ROM for the translation, and not one of the many mapper hacks out there. This translation is finished and complete.

patch.name: Bio Senshi Dan - Increaser Tono Tatakai (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Bio Senshi Dan - Increaser Tono Tatakai (J) [!].nes

game.name: 647 - Dragon Ball Z - Kyoushuu! Saiya Jin (J) [!]
game.description: Dragon Ball Z - Kyoushuu! Saiya Jin (J) [!]
game.info: New things in version 1.00/1.01: Rewritten scripts (hella better read); Huffman compression (didn’t have to shave even one letter off the scripts after the rewriting/editing was finished!); The text windows now hold twice the amount of text as before; The two previously “unfixable” bugs are fixed; And a kick-ass title screen made specifically for this patch (thanks Elf).

patch.name: Dragon Ball Z - Kyoushuu! Saiya Jin (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Dragon Ball Z - Kyoushuu! Saiya Jin (J) [!].nes

game.name: 651 - Kaiketsu Yanchamaru 3 - Taiketsu! Zouringen (J) [!]
game.info: Everything’s translated, including all text and graphics. Well, except for the note in the intro, but I don’t think anyone’s going to be confused as to what TASUKETE means (hint: your first guess is totally correct). This patch also gets bonus cool points for staying true to the original Kid Niki’s bizarrely-translated wackiness. WILL HELP YOU!

game.name: 652 - Wit's (J) [!]
game.info: Well, the translation is good, especially since there seemed to be some technical issues with hacking this game. The only japanese text was the intro, which you can read in the game review above.

game.name: 659 - Spartan X 2 (J) [!]
game.info: As I said above, this is the sequel to Kung Fu. This game was considered unhackable until occluded hairdo and parasyte proved otherwise.

game.name: 662 - Spelunker 2 - Yuusha e no Chousen (J) [!]
game.info: The only reason this patch is at version 0.9 is because you can apparently continue using controller 2 somehow, but Sarysa can’t figure out how. Shouldn’t ruin the game for all you savestate-happy freaks out there though.

game.name: 663 - Labyrinth (J) [!]
game.info: This patch is now currently offered here at RHDN. This patch was previously only available at the Suicidal Translations page. Unfortunately, Suicidal Translations has died, and the author, Inverse, is unreachable for potentially several years due to a personal situation.

game.name: 668 - Paaman Part 2 - Himitsu Kessha Madoodan wo Taose! (J) [!]
game.description: Paaman Part 2 - Himitsu Kessha Madoodan wo Taose! (J) [!]
game.info: Well there doesn’t look like there’s much text in the game (aside from the usual crazy prologue), but it all looks very very nice. And it’s finished!

patch.name: Paaman Part 2 - Himitsu Kessha Madoodan wo Taose! (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Paaman Part 2 - Himitsu Kessha Madoodan wo Taose! (J) [!].nes

game.name: 676 - Bio Miracle Bokutte Upa (J) [!]
game.info: All the game needed was a title screen hack. So here ya go. Could’ve been better though.

game.name: 678 - Yume Penguin Monogatari (J)
game.info: Everything’s translated! WOOOO! All the stuff that you’ll actually SEE, anyway. Kitsune mentions that there’s some untranslated text in the rom that refers to a level that was - I assume - cut from the game during development, so you never see it during the course of normal gameplay. So don’t worry about it. Just play the thing and have fun.

game.name: 683 - Advanced Dungeons & Dragons - Dragons of Flame (J) [!]
game.description: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons - Dragons of Flame (J) [!]
game.info: Everything is translated as of this release, and the job done on it is superb. Overall a very nice translation.

patch.name: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons - Dragons of Flame (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons - Dragons of Flame (J) [!].nes

game.name: 685 - Banana Prince (G) [!]
game.info: Everything’s complete, although this script really could’ve used an edit. Some of the things people say make absolutely no sense, and some of it is outright contradictory. It makes for a very silly game.

game.name: 700 - Attack Animal Gakuen (J) [!]
game.info: This patch translates the title screen. Not that there was anything else that needed it, but it does a good job of what it does!

game.name: 704 - Dezaemon (J) [!]
game.info: Years ago, there was a discussion on a message board (probably Demi’s) about Dezaemon, this nifty make-your-own-shooter game. Lagomorph threw together this quick translation and uploaded it, so that everyone could stop guessing on what all the options were. It was originally distributed as a hacked ROM, so we at the Whirlpool provide this IPS patch for your legal satisfaction.

game.name: 706 - Musashi no Bouken (J) [!]
game.info: One sentence in the intro is translated, and most of the menus are done. That’s all.

game.name: 707 - Radia Senki - Reimei Hen (J) [!]
game.info: A few menus are very, very badly done. That’s about it.

game.name: 708 - Kouryuu Densetsu Villgust Gaiden (J)
game.info: This patch pretty much translates all of the first area. The menu is all yucky squishy text, but what’re ya gonna do.

game.name: 709 - Ys II - Ancient Ys Vanished - The Final Chapter (J) [!]
game.description: Ys II - Ancient Ys Vanished - The Final Chapter (J) [!]
game.info: Quite a lot is translated in this patch; I didn’t get very far in the game though, so I can’t tell you what exactly. But a lot! I went through the entire first town and messed around the menus and only encountered one instance of gibberish, which, if you know anything about abandoned 1998 translation projects, is pretty damn good. It’s still been eclipsed by David Mullen’s project though, so it’s not really worth messing with.

patch.name: Ys II - Ancient Ys Vanished - The Final Chapter (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Ys II - Ancient Ys Vanished - The Final Chapter (J) [!].nes

game.name: 710 - Kyatto Ninden Teyandee (J) [!]
game.info: The first level is translated, then it all deteriorates into gibberish. Whee!

game.name: 730 - Akumajou Densetsu (J) [!]
game.info: I’m certain we have a hack of Akumajou Densetsu somewhere around here, but unlike that patch, which was just the English script cut-n’-pasted into the Japanese ROM, this one’s from scratch, translated from the original script. Of course, this also means the original names apply (Trevor Belmont is now Ralph Belmond), but also gone are the dubious errors (”Bad world full of evil”). But yeah, whether be it Trevor, Ralph, Bad world or evil, Akamajou Densetsu is a game to play. Only now there’s no Nintendo censorship to get in the way of things. Wee! Version 1.0 features a title screen replacement courtesy of BMF54123.

game.name: 739 - Exciting Rally - World Rally Championship (J)
game.info: Pretty much all that SirYoink had to do was change the title screen and the name entry. And that he did! So there ya go.

game.name: 741 - Airwolf (J) [!]
game.info: Everything’s translated. And does Kitsune use that font for all his games or what?

game.name: 744 - JJ - Tobidase Daisakusen Part 2 (J) [!]
game.info: Not much at all needed translating, just the title screen and the ending.

game.name: 756 - Dragon Buster II - Yami no Fuuin (J) [!]
game.description: Dragon Buster II - Yami no Fuuin (J) [!]
game.info: Everything’s translated – in other words, the title screen and the credits that may or may not be used. Woo!

patch.name: Dragon Buster II - Yami no Fuuin (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Dragon Buster II - Yami no Fuuin (J) [!].nes

game.name: 759 - Crayon Shin-Chan - Ora to Poi Poi (J) [!]
game.description: Crayon Shin-Chan - Ora to Poi Poi (J) [!]
game.info: Not much is translated, just various graphics, and a chunk of the first scenario thingy.

patch.name: Crayon Shin-Chan - Ora to Poi Poi (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Crayon Shin-Chan - Ora to Poi Poi (J) [!].nes

game.name: 764 - Portopia Renzoku Satsujin Jiken (J) [!]
game.info: Over 4 years since we released Rev. A and we are finally done with the project. We are all VERY happy to be done with this project. Our beta testers really liked the improvements to the script and we hope you will too.

game.name: 766 - Wily & Light no Rockboard - That's Paradise (J) [!]
game.description: Wily & Light no Rockboard - That's Paradise (J) [!]
game.info: All in-game text has been replaced, along with the appropriate graphics. This makes the game fully playable in English.

patch.name: Wily & Light no Rockboard - That's Paradise (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Wily & Light no Rockboard - That's Paradise (J) [!].nes

game.name: 773 - Lupin Sansei - Pandora no Isan (J) [!]
game.info: This is an English translation of Lupin Sansei: Pandora no Isan for the Nintendo Entertainment System.

game.name: 774 - Armadillo (J) [!]
game.info: The game is 100% done, except for a couple of messages that are apparently unused. There’s a small freezing bug near the end that seems to happen at random, so keep your savestates handy!

game.name: 784 - Kart Fighter (Unl)
game.info: The original game contains the Japanese names of characters, Yossy for Yoshi, Nokonoko for Koopa Troopa, Koopa for Bowser, plus some intentional incorrect spellings, Mari for Mario, etc. This patch fixes all the character names you see both during the game and on the high score table, and also makes a few small graphical changes, to further enhance your Kart Fighter experience.

game.name: 785 - Popeye no Eigo Asobi (Japan)
game.info: KingMike had to do some crazy fun things to translate this game, so the ROM must be expanded to 40KB before you patch it. There’s a text file in the zip named POPEXP.TXT that will walk you through it. If your patch doesn’t work, THIS IS MOST LIKELY THE PROBLEM.

game.name: 825 - Sore Ike! Anapanman - Minna de Hiking Game! (J) [!]
game.description: Sore Ike! Anapanman - Minna de Hiking Game! (J) [!]
game.info: The game, sadly, is still unfinished. There are tons of untranslated graphics abound, and there are some text display glitches relating to Japanese punctuation. And then there’s the whole grammar thing.

patch.name: Sore Ike! Anapanman - Minna de Hiking Game! (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Sore Ike! Anapanman - Minna de Hiking Game! (J) [!].nes

game.name: 838 - Saiyuuki World 2 - Tenjoukai no Majin (J) [!]
game.info: Saiyuki World 2 is a decent platformer, based on Saiyuuki / Journey to the West, in which monkey dude Son Goku is collecting seven balls to give to Buddha, for some reason. But the balls let him do shit like shoot fire, spin his stick around and float around a bit on a cloud, so yeah. It was released in the US as Whomp ‘Em, with Son Goku changed to a Native American kid, a totem pole instead of Buddha and some of the enemies are different. So this is a translation of what little text there was in the original.

game.name: 839 - Parallel World (J)
game.info: All that needed doing, apparently, was the title screen and credits, but they’re done, so booyah!

game.name: 844 - Bikkuriman World - Gekitou Sei Senshi (J) [!]
game.info: First town’s done, a bunch of battle text, etc. Seems like they’ve got a fairly good grasp on the stuff required for romhacking, although that font could use some help.

game.name: 85 - Hyaku no Sekai no Monogatari - The Tales on a Watery Wilderness (J)
game.description: Hyaku no Sekai no Monogatari - The Tales on a Watery Wilderness (J)
game.info: Midas has done a great job translating this, as I can only imagine there must be tons of text in this little game. The only problem (and it’s kind of a big one) is that the translation won’t work in a lot of emulators. Use NESticle for best results, even if it’s an ancient pain in the ass.

patch.name: Hyaku no Sekai no Monogatari - The Tales on a Watery Wilderness (J).ips

rom.name: Hyaku no Sekai no Monogatari - The Tales on a Watery Wilderness (J).nes

game.name: 86 - Takahashi Meijin no Bouken Shima IV (J)
game.description: Takahashi Meijin no Bouken Shima IV (J)
game.info: Again, Demi does a great job translating this game, fortunately leaving out the “yaya” stuff that’s been in some of his earlier work. And the title screen is super sweet, even though I took the pic in NESticle and the colors are all weird. Now go thank him right now for allowing you to play this gem! Right now goddammit!

patch.name: Takahashi Meijin no Bouken Shima IV (J).ips

rom.name: Takahashi Meijin no Bouken Shima IV (J).nes

game.name: 864 - Kekkyoku Nankyoku Daibouken (J) (REV0) [!]
game.info: This is one of the frickin’ smallest patches we have hosted here. The game didn’t really have much to translate other than one line. One FRICKIN’ line. In the map screen, you formerly had three kanjis. Now there’s a line that says “South Pole”. And the font was cleaned up a bit. And there’s an ad for DvD Translations in the title. And that’s it.

game.name: 87 - Musashi no Bouken (J) [!]
game.info: The hacking and translation for this game are both really great, especially when you consider that DW-type RPGs are a pain in the ass to translate. Believe me, I’ve been there. The readme says there’s still some bugs, but I got about an hour, maybe two hours into it with no problems. So at the very least, you can play this for five minutes and laugh at how cool it is before you move on to the next rom in your collection. I wouldn’t recommend it though. Cmon, the game’s fun!

game.name: 875 - Star Wars (J) (Namco) [!]
game.info: Well everything text wise is done. That means that the ability menu and dialogue screens are fully translated from the original, which used katakana to display everything. Not a bad job, just don’t mind the overusing of ellipses everywhere.

game.name: 88 - Valkyrie no Bouken - Toki no Kagi Densetsu (Japan)
game.description: Valkyrie no Bouken - Toki no Kagi Densetsu (Japan)
game.info: What’s to translate? Look, just be happy that this is finally in English, and try not to think too much about it.

patch.name: Valkyrie no Bouken - Toki no Kagi Densetsu (Japan).ips

rom.name: Valkyrie no Bouken - Toki no Kagi Densetsu (Japan).nes

game.name: 882 - Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque - La Legende d'Or (F) [!]
game.description: Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque - La Legende d'Or (F) [!]
game.info: The translation of this game is pretty mediocre, which puts it a few ranks above the game itself which is a pile of shit. It’s probably the sheer crappiness of the game that has made this review end up so vitriolic.

patch.name: Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque - La Legende d'Or (F) [!].ips

rom.name: Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque - La Legende d'Or (F) [!].nes

game.name: 886 - Juuouki (J) [!]
game.info: As far as I can tell, this patch will translate that pesky Japanese title screen into something more familiar. I wish I could tell you more, but after spending about an hour being terrible at the game, the frustration got to me and I gave up hope that there might be translated text at the end. Plus, the readme doesn’t really go into details, but considering the nature of the game that’s fair enough.

game.name: 888 - Chiisana Obake - Acchi Socchi Kocchi (J)
game.info: Everythings english! Not that there appeared to be much that needed translation. Go get it now!

game.name: 89 - Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk (J) [!]
game.description: Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk (J) [!]
game.info: This is about 30% translated, according to legend. Unfortunately, I suck at it too much and can’t say for certain. I can say, however, they should’ve re-sized those windows so that the arrow cursor doesn’t overlap the selections.

patch.name: Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Aigiina no Yogen - From The Legend of Balubalouk (J) [!].nes

game.name: 891 - Nekketsu Kouha - Kunio-kun (J) [!]
game.info: Apparently this was a quick and easy patch, and there’s not really much to rate except the nice title screen and the fact that what text there is in the game makes sense. Hurrah! By the way, I suck mightily at this game, which you may be able to tell from the fact that the only proper gameplay shot is on the first screen.

game.name: 894 - Kanshakudama Nage Kantarou no Toukaidou Gojuusan Tsugi (J) [!]
game.description: Kanshakudama Nage Kantarou no Toukaidou Gojuusan Tsugi (J) [!]
game.info: The translation’s pretty well done, especially considering the small amount of space that KingMike had to work with. Basically the messages between levels and other system messages were translated, as were some graphics in the game that indicate scoring and progress. It must’ve been a pain in the butt having to do all that with an 8×8 square, lemme tell you that.

patch.name: Kanshakudama Nage Kantarou no Toukaidou Gojuusan Tsugi (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Kanshakudama Nage Kantarou no Toukaidou Gojuusan Tsugi (J) [!].nes

game.name: 898 - Dragon Ball Z III - Ressen Jinzou Ningen (J) [!]
game.description: Dragon Ball Z III - Ressen Jinzou Ningen (J) [!]
game.info: This should be a completed patch with no known issues at this time.

patch.name: Dragon Ball Z III - Ressen Jinzou Ningen (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Dragon Ball Z III - Ressen Jinzou Ningen (J) [!].nes

game.name: 899 - Dragon Ball Z Gaiden - Saiya Jin Zetsumetsu Keikaku (J) [!]
game.description: Dragon Ball Z Gaiden - Saiya Jin Zetsumetsu Keikaku (J) [!]
game.info: Everything is finished. There’s two patches: one allows Vegeta to be controlled by the player, while the other allows the CPU to retain control.

patch.name: Dragon Ball Z Gaiden - Saiya Jin Zetsumetsu Keikaku (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Dragon Ball Z Gaiden - Saiya Jin Zetsumetsu Keikaku (J) [!].nes

game.name: 90 - Akira (J) [a1]
game.info: This is a patch that is (for me at least) shrouded in mystery. This patch was added to Omizone during one of his updates, even though the actual page (which has since been presumably deleted) was never updated with a patch.

game.name: 904 - Hirake! Ponkikki (J) [!]
game.info: Oh boy, a complete translation. The translation does feel a bit odd in places, be it intentional mispellings for space (Moutain?) or the use of the word “Notice” instead of “Score” or something on the score screen, but chances are by that point in the game you’ll be too busy rolling on the floor clutching your head and weeping to notice.

game.name: 905 - Hirake! Ponkikki (J) [!]
game.info: This translation is very mysterious. The page it was originally posted on offered little more than a ROM and screenshots, so we have no idea who made it. Also, since the translation was originally distributed as a ROM, we have taken the liberty of making an IPS patch for our archive.

game.name: 911 - Famicom Wars (J) [o2]
game.info: Seems pretty cool. He made little icons for the funky vertical menus down at the bottom of the screen! This patch should now be complete with the latest update.

game.name: 92 - Kouryuu Densetsu Villgust Gaiden (J)
game.info: The first thing you’ll notice about this translation is the profanity, let’s be honest. You’ll see the F-bomb dropped at least once. It doesn’t bother me personally as long as it’s not out-of-place (and, admittedly, it sometimes is), but according to the readme, it was all in the original game anyways. Of course, Japanese words like “kuso” can be translated into a lot of different things.

game.name: 93 - Artelius (J) [!]
game.info: This patch translates very little text, and the text that is translated comes in the form of a very disjointed and broken English. I’d actually go as far as to venture to say that the game was better off in Japanese.

game.name: 934 - Dark Lord (J)
game.info: This is an English translation of Dark Lord for the NES.

game.name: 94 - Asmik-kun Land (J) [!]
game.info: The readme says it’s at 25%, and I see no reason to say otherwise. A script edit would be very useful here though, or at least a spellcheck. Moutain?

game.name: 941 - Egger Land - Meikyuu no Fukkatsu (J) [!]
game.info: This is a nearly complete v0.9 release. Everything important (dialogue wise) is translated. There’s a large sign that says “Defeat Lolo” that isn’t done. The passwords are still in kana, and if that’s changed, the two secret phrases need to be changed to read something in English.

game.name: 944 - Karnov (Japan) (Rev 1)
game.info: This patch is supposed to be complete. Kitsune did all the hacking, with some help from RedComet for locating the pointers. It was translated by Eien Ni Hen, so expect a quality translation.

game.name: 946 - Batman (U) [!]
game.info: Spanish translation patch for Batman (US version). The game’s complete -except- for the credits, which can’t be modified without ASM hacks. The patch was finished in 2003, however it wasn’t publically released until now.

game.name: 95 - Astro Fang - Super Machine (J) [!]
game.info: It’s really hard to find stuff to say about complete translations. Um, it’s all in english. Have fun. Use a clean, original Japanese rom. Um, have fun.

game.name: 955 - Pescatore (J) (Prototype) [!]
game.info: There wasn’t much text in this game, but what was there is translated. You may experience some glitches, but they are most likely fault of the game itself rather than the patch. This was an unfinished, unreleased game of course.

game.name: 959 - Nekketsu Koukou Dodgeball Bu - Soccer Hen (J) [!]
game.description: Nekketsu Koukou Dodgeball Bu - Soccer Hen (J) [!]
game.info: Note: This patch is for Nekketsu Koukou Dodge Ball Bu, the Japanese version of the game ONLY.

patch.name: Nekketsu Koukou Dodgeball Bu - Soccer Hen (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Nekketsu Koukou Dodgeball Bu - Soccer Hen (J) [!].nes

game.name: 96 - Bloody Warriors - Shan-Go no Gyakushuu (J) [!]
game.info: So far, the first town’s text is translated. However, as is to be expected of any beta, there’s some spelling and grammar errors, but I think this translation will do fine as time goes on. The newest version features more translated monster and item names, translated menus, and (made-up) English names for the characters. DodgyAussie is still working on the game, he’s just lazy and isn’t doing anything to it at the moment. I’ll be the last to blame him for it.

game.name: 97 - Captain Tsubasa (J) [!]
game.info: Oct. 19th 2007 Addendum - knighTeen87’s Addendum Patch was released Oct 9th, 2007 and translates some additional material.

game.name: 970 - Dai Meiro - Meikyuu no Tatsujin (J) [!]
game.info: Complete translation with no currently known issues. Available in both NINJA (.RUP) and IPS format patches.

game.name: 971 - Dragon Warrior (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: The three Swedish letters Å, Ä and Ö and å, ä and ö are not actually selectable for character names, even though they appear in the list. There are also some other minor issues.

game.name: 976 - Tokkyuu Shirei - Solbrain (J)
game.info: This translation is based on AGTP’s English translation, however, the patch should be used on the Japanese rom. There are two graphic bugs, one is when you finish stage F and the other is when you finish stage E, other than that everything is okay.

game.name: 978 - Hello Kitty World (J)
game.info: This translation is based on Suicidal Translations’ translation but the patch should be used with the Japanese rom.

game.name: 979 - Hello Kitty no Ohanabatake (J)
game.info: This translation is based on Suicidal Translations’ translation. The archive contains two IPS patches to be applied to the Japanese and English ROMs respectively.

game.name: 980 - Sanrio Carnival 2 (J) [!]
game.info: This translation is based on Suicidal Translations’ translation but the patch should be used with the Japanese rom.

game.name: 981 - Minna no Taabou no Nakayoshi Daisakusen (Japan)
game.description: Minna no Taabou no Nakayoshi Daisakusen (Japan)
game.info: This is a Swedish translation of Minna no Taabou no Nakayoshi Daisakusen for the NES. This translation is based on Suicidal Translations’s English translation but the patch should be used with the Japanese ROM.

patch.name: Minna no Taabou no Nakayoshi Daisakusen (Japan).ips

rom.name: Minna no Taabou no Nakayoshi Daisakusen (Japan).nes

game.name: 983 - Shadow Warriors - Ninja Gaiden (Europe)
game.info: This is a Swedish translation of the European version of Ninja Gaiden called Shadow Warriors for the NES.

game.name: 984 - Blue Shadow (E) [!]
game.info: This translation is of the European Blue Shadow.

game.name: 986 - Bucky O'Hare (U) [!]
game.info: This is a translation of the American rom of Bucky O’Hare.

game.name: 987 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: This patch a Swedish translation of is for Castlevania II: Simon’s Quest.

game.name: 988 - Chip 'n Dale Rescue Rangers 2 (U) [!]
game.info: This is a Swedish translation of Disney’s Chip ‘n Dale: Rescue Rangers 2 for the NES.

game.name: 989 - Duck Tales (U) [!]
game.info: Other than a minor spelling error, it is 100% done.

game.name: 99 - Chaos World (J)
game.info: In the zip are two patches: A and B. Patch A includes a bug where talking to the old woman by the grave at the beginning causes her to shout gibberish and have you get attacked by invincible enemies. Patch B doesn’t have this ‘feature’(Well, maybe it’s not so much a feature as it you getting your ass kicked in for no apparent reason, but you know what I mean).

game.name: 990 - Duck Tales (U) [!]
game.info: Only Time and Game Over are not translated.

game.name: 991 - Zombie Nation (U) [!]
game.info: This is a Swedish translation of Zombie Nation for the NES.

game.name: 993 - Conquest of the Crystal Palace (U) [!]
game.info: Some text is not translated because the translator couldn’t find it. Some stuff is changed, for example, the name of the dog (Zap) since the translator needed to remove Z to add the swedish letter Ö.

game.name: 994 - Mario & Yoshi (E) [!]
game.info: There’s only a minor graphics bug when someone wins a 2 player match.

game.name: 998 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This one is missing the readme and therefore any problems are unknown. Judging from the screenshots, though, all the Swedish letters are there. If you wanna know more, try it out!

game.name: 999 - Gun.Smoke (U) [!]
game.info: This is a Swedish translation of Gun.Smoke for the NES.
